title: 'The Walking Dead' Star Andrew Lincoln Talks 'Love Actually' Sequel | moviepilot.com
text:
'It's Very Exciting': Andrew Lincoln Is Totally Feeling The 'Love Actually' Sequel In His Fingers And His Toes February 23, 2017 at 09:19AM By Varia Fedko-Blake , writer at creators.co 'Love Actually' [Credit: Universal Pictures] Staff Writer at Moviepilot! [email protected] 
We all leapt for joy last week when news hit that Richard Curtis's epic festive classic Love Actually will be getting a sequel for Red Nose Day, airing in the US on NBC on March 25. 
With the reunion brewing for 14 years, a number of stars are gathering to spread the love and their personal excitement about the next instalment — and we can all breathe a sigh of relief knowing that The Walking Dead actor Andrew Lincoln managed to take a pause from blasting zombie brains out of his way to be one of them. Andrew Lincoln in 'The Walking Dead' [Credit: AMC] 
Abandoning the cue cards he once needed to fully express himself in that heartwarming scene Love Actually , Andrew used actual words this time to relay how he heard about the new project from the director. He said: 
"Richard got in touch about a month ago and mentioned he had something in mind. I’m shooting something in March." 
Thankfully, Lincoln found some time out of his busy schedule to help shoot this greatly-anticipated "little mini-revival" and to show audiences what ultimately happened between his character, love-torn Mark, and Keira Knightley's lovely Juliet:
